item.title: Kawai add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "The very least you can do in your life is figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope. Not admire it from a distance but live right in it, under its roof." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Kawai add a quote by Marion Zimmer Bradley
item.description: "There is no such thing as a true tale. Truth has many faces and the truth is like to the old road to Avalon; it depends on your own will, and your own thoughts, whither the road will take you." -- Marion Zimmer Bradley

item.title: Kawai add a quote by Anita Diamant
item.description: "The painful things seemed like knots on a beautiful necklace, necessary for keeping the beads in place." -- Anita Diamant

item.title: Kawai add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "War is what happens when language fails." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Kawai add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "People worry about kids playing with guns, and teenagers watching violent videos; we are scared that some sort of culture of violence will take them over. Nobody worries about kids listening to thousands - literally thousands - of songs about broken hearts and rejection and pain and misery and loss." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Kawai add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "It seems to me now that the plain state of being human is dramatic enough for anyone; you don't need to be a heroin addict or a performance poet to experience extremity. You just have to love someone." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Kawai add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "Maybe we all live life at too high a pitch, those of us who absorb emotional things all day, and as mere consequence we can never feel merely content: we have to be unhappy, or ecstatically, head-over-heels happy, and those states are difficult to achieve within a stable, solid relationship." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Kawai add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "One could argue that most of the trouble in the world is caused by introspection." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Kawai add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "Love, it turns out, is as undemocratic as money, so it accumulates around people who have plenty of it already: the sane, the healthy, the lovable." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Kawai add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "We all spend so much time not saying what we want, because we know we can't have it. And because it sounds ungracious, or ungrateful, or disloyal, or childish, or banal. Or because we're so desperate to pretend that things are OK, really, that confessing to ourselves they're not looks like a bad move. Go on, say what you want. ... Whatever it is, say it to yourself. The truth will set you free. Either that or it'll get you a punch in the nose. Surviving in whatever life you're living means lying, and lying corrodes the soul, so take a break from the lies for just one minute." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Kawai add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "I've committed to nothing...and that's just suicide...by tiny, tiny increments." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Kawai add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "I'm a good person. In most ways. But I'm beginning to think that being a good person in most ways doesn't count for anything very much, if you're a bad person in one way." -- Nick Hornby
